__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on '''Pitivi'''! 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your '''Launchpad Id''' in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged. 

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

To sign up for 5-A-Day participation, please add your Launchpad ID to the Participants column. (This is not the email address you used for signing up for LP, but the last part of the URL that https://launchpad.net/people/+me redirects you to (everything behind the ~ sign)):

1. Click on https://launchpad.net/people/+me
2. Look at the URL bar, everything behind the ~ sign is your Launchpad ID. 

Also sign up here: https://launchpad.net/~5-a-day-participants/+join

=== Information ===

For debugging information please have a look to the official <nowiki>[[http://www.pitivi.org/?go=bugs|Pitivi Debugging page]]</nowiki>

Before submitting any bug to the <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.gnome.org|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki> please make sure that the issue is reproducible with latest Pitivi version available on Lucid and try to provide the debug log when possible (see below).

=== Stock Responses ===

<pre>
Thank you for taking the time to report this bug and helping to make Ubuntu better. However your report is missing some information, may you please run pitivi as: PITIVI_DEBUG=*:5 GST_DEBUG=2 bin/pitivi > debug.log 2>&1 . Compress that log file with gzip, bzip2, etc and attach it to the report? Thanks in advance!.
</pre>

For problem specific Stock Responses see: <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses]]</nowiki>

=== 1 Bugs to be forwarded Upstream ===

** Verify the bug is still not fixed
** Search in the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/Upstream/|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki> for a similar report, if there is no one, open a new report and add a <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/Watches|Bug watch]]</nowiki> to the downstream report.
